abstract: Chinese authorities reportedly kill 17 people linked to September knife attack in volatile Xinjiang region that left 50 people dead; raid, part of effort to crack down on separatist movement in Uighur minorities, has been condemned by rights advocates.
lead_paragraph: The dead, including women and children, were said to have been involved in a knife attack in September that left 50 people dead at a mine near the Kyrgyzstan border.

headline.main: Police in China Kill 17 Linked to Mine Attack, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Police in China Said to Kill 17 Linked to Knife Attack at Mine

snippet: The dead, including women and children, were said to have been involved in a knife attack in September that left 50 people dead at a mine near the Kyrgyzstan border.
